short_summary: Garbage Collection and Disposal-Cape Breton Highlands NP- Ingonish
description: The respondent must collect recyclables and support regular surveys to obtain accurate data for the collection frequency.",
full_summary:
# Invitation to Tender

## Service Description

Parks Canada is seeking bids for the provision of Garbage Collection and Disposal services in the Cape Breton Highlands National Park, specifically within the Eastern Management Area. The successful bidder will be required to collect and dispose of garbage and recyclables within the designated area.

## Contract Duration and Delivery

The period of the contract is from April 1, 2023 to March 31, 2024, with the option to extend for two additional one-year periods. Bidders should ensure that their submissions take this into account.

## Tender Requirements

Bidders must submit their proposals in accordance with the requirements outlined in the solicitation documents. Documents may be submitted in either English or French.

## Contact Information

* Contact Person: Knott, Bonnie
* Email: [bonnie.knott@pc.gc.ca](mailto:bonnie.knott@pc.gc.ca)
* Phone: 709-636-4953
* Fax: 1-877-558-2349

## Tender Submission

Bids must be submitted via facsimile or email to the address above. Bids received in-person or by courier will not be accepted. The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is [soumissionsest@pc.gc.ca](mailto:soumissionsest@pc.gc.ca). The maximum email file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes.

## Documents and Attachments

Bid documents must be sent as email attachments. Documents may be obtained from the Government Electronic Tendering Service through the Government of Canada tendering service at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities).

## Solicitation Documents

The solicitation documents, including addenda, are available from the Government of Canada tendering service. Bidders are responsible for ensuring they have the most up-to-date documents throughout the bidding process.

## Authorities and Regulations

All work must be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.

## Important Notes

Late submissions will not be considered. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. The Government of Canada is an equal opportunities employer and encourages diversity in the workplace.
